experience: My role is to help drive new and existing business with strategic and enterprise accounts. This is achieved by managing our product and technology through the evaluation stage of the sales process.   Nitro is changing the way the world works with documents. As the global leader in document productivity solutions, Nitro enables people to work smarter every day with their documents, on the desktop, and in the cloud. From PDF creation, conversion, editing and reviewing capabilities, to cloud-enabled workflows for secure sharing, collaboration, and electronic signatures, Nitro offers best-in-class solutions that every knowledge worker in an organization should use to improve productivity, document security, and corporate sustainability. ☆ April 2017, Nitro Raises US$15m Series C Funding Round to Further Accelerate Growth in the Enterprise

If you're looking for a print management solution, start with PrinterLogic! I joined PrinterLogic in the start-up phase to help structure the customer-centric engineering teams. Created a culture of customer satisfaction, communication, process, and leadership.   • Developed the global strategy and managing day-to-day operations of pre-sale engineering, channel partner training, and professional services.• Lead an international technical sales team selling on-premises and SaaS solutions. • Measured performance metrics in order to identify specific areas of improvement using leading indicators, KPIs, and performance analytics.• Developed a net-new professional services department delivering services globally leveraging the ITIL framework. • Communicated change strategies, build relationships, inspire stakeholder engagement, train staff and encourage cultural change at different operational levels. • Systematized process and tools for project management and customer care methodology.• Professional services profit and loss (P&L). Company Awards:☆ Ranked  one of INC. Magazine’s Best Workplaces 2017             https://www.inc.com/profile/printerlogic?cid=best-workplaces_list☆  Ranked  141 on the 2016 Inc. 5000 with Three-Year Sales Growth of 2,480.2%☆  Ranked 107th Fastest Growing Company in North America on Deloitte’s Technology Fast 500☆  Ranked 15th on the Utah 100 Fastest Growing Companies of 2016☆ Outstanding Enterprise Print Environment Platform: BLI Labs 2016☆ Virtualization and Cloud Infrastructure Category: Best of VMworld 2015 Award Finalist☆ Dreamforce 2015 Sharing Best Practices for Hyper-Growth Businesses ☆ NPS +66

College Bound is a 501(c)3 nonprofit mentorship and college preparatory program. Arizona Department of Education Educator ID: 4710293http://www.collegeboundaz.org/about-us/board-members/The board has decision-making powers regarding matters of policy, direction, strategy, and governance of College Bound AZ.Formulate key corporate policies and strategic goals, focusing both on near-term and longer-term challenges and opportunities.Authorize major transactions or other actions.Oversee critical aspects such as the viability of its business model and the integrity of its internal systems and controls.Mentor senior management, provide resources, advice, and introductions to help facilitate operations.

While reporting to the VP of Technology Services, I was responsible for leading the document imaging strategic accounts sales engineering and consulting services team in the America's Region. Supporting project member in over $600 million in acquisitions.•   Created strategic engagement plans to build, retain and extend brand presence in strategic accounts in the Americas and Fortune 500 multinational companies. •   Delivered product presentations and demonstrations from the C-Suite level down and facilitate services negotiations with key decision makers. •   Lead client adoption of new software and hardware technology from pre-sales to implementation. •   Provided technical architecture analysis, planning design, resources and timescales for professional services opportunities.•   Project Manager for software customizations. •   Negotiated terms and conditions for master professional service agreements and statements of work in compliance with existing VSOE rules . •   Supporting project member in $600+ million in mergers and acquisitions (M&A)   -  2009 eCopy Inc    -   2010 X-Solutions Inc   -   2011 Equitrac   -   2012 SafeCom    -   2012 Copitrak    -   2014 Notable Solutions Inc Nuance Awards and Accomplishments •    2011 Chairman's Club.•    2012 lead architect and consultant to extend Nuance capture solutions to automate the conversion of paper into Electronic Medical Records using HL7 CDA Standard. Launched the solution at HIMSS 2012.•    2013 Chairman's Club.•    2014 Chairman's Club.•    2014 Nuance World Wide Sales Engineer of the YearCompany Profile: Nuance Communications, Inc. (NASDAQ: NUAN) is a leading provider of voice, language, and document imaging solutions for businesses and consumers around the world. Its technologies, applications and services make the user experience more compelling by transforming the way people interact with devices and systems. In fiscal 2014, Nuance sales exceeded $1.98B in non GAAP revenue.

While reporting to the Director of Sales Engineering, delivered field based channel communication for ongoing acquisitions including X-Solutions and eCopy while managing a thirteen-state territory with the Director of Sales. •   Cultivated strong channel relationships with dealerships, manufacturers and software vendors.•   Delivered sales support to grow channel sales 60% in 24 months by closing marquee accounts. •   Managed customization projects from end-to-end.•   Provided technical architecture analysis, planning design, resources and timescales for professional services opportunities.•   Trained partner and end-customers on software applications in a classroom and virtual environment. •   Developed overall solution design; managed statements of work and bill of materials. •   Subject matter expert for document capture including, ad-hoc, workflow and data extraction.Nuance Awards and Accomplishments•	2010 Engineering Excellence Award. •	2010 Served on the Nuance America’s Sales Advisory Council.•	Promoted to run Strategic Accounts Sales Engineering and ConsultingCompany Profile: Nuance Communications, Inc. (NASDAQ: NUAN) is a leading provider of voice, language, and document imaging solutions for businesses and consumers around the world. Nuance  2010 fiscal sales exceeded $1.11B in non GAAP revenue. During Q3 of 2010, eCopy products had its best bookings quarter in 6 quarter. Src: Nuance 2010 Earnings Announcement
R&D Manager Computer and Network Systems

The Product Development and Fulfillment (PD&F) team was led by Vice President of Product Development, Richard Brock. IKON PD&F had five core areas; Development, Marketing, Fulfillment, Training and Support.• While reporting to the Director of Product Development I primarily managed two technical teams in development and integration testing. • At times acted as the Interim Manager of Support and IT Manager during staffing transition periods.  • Responsible for quality control from pre-production planning to final product for software by IKON.• Developed and implemented processes and procedures for the internal audit program for the Integration and Research and Development departments. • Reduced integration costs by 25% by creating integration standards and employee training programs.•  Developed and implemented software discrepancy reporting system for corrective action with strategic partners.• Example of new Product Development (NPD) of OEM partner development was the EFI project. Together our companies delivered IKON DocSend in the America's and  EFI SendMe in Europe. • Technical writer for online material including white papers, technical specifications and FAQs.Company Profile: Prior to Ricoh Ltd acquisition of IKON Office Solutions, it was a publicly traded company.  IKON was the world's largest independent distribution channel for copier and printer technologies, IKON offers best-in-class systems from leading manufacturers such as Canon, Ricoh and HP and service support through its team of 7,000 service professionals worldwide. With Fiscal 2003 revenues of $4.7 billion, IKON had approximately 600 locations throughout North America and Europe.
Contractor at BP America Oil Traders International Division

• Six month contract to lead system support during product upgrades. • Project lead for the Petroleum Analysis Workstation (PAWS) database upgrade. • Delivered procedural documentation and data analysis during system transition.• Co-authored the disaster recovery procedures for the Oil Traders International (OTI) division.• Performed internal audits and end user surveys while acting as the liaison between the software engineers, information technology staff and end users.• Analyzed application needs for users in the United States, EMEA and APAC and met with in-house software developers to process change requests and feature enhancements.
Leading a five person contract team for application and systems administrations for end-users.

Adjunct Professor at Western International University
March 16, 2015, Lola A. was Luke’s teacher

It was my pleasure to teach a class, INS 601 - International Business Environment at West (Western International University),  where Mr. Sigrist was a student in the class. Mr. Sigrist won the Professor's Earliest Post Award several times before the class ended. Mr. Sigrist displayed scholastic superiority in his academic discussions and in his research work.  Mr. Sigrist always reviewed comments and corrections passed in his written assignments and always made necessary adjustments in subsequent papers. I highly recommend Mr. Sigrist as a first class learner and would be glad to provide more information should that become necessary.Prof. Lola Davis
